H0.text: What name is given to the declaration of aims and policies of a political party before an election. Platform

H1.text: What name is given to the declaration of aims and policies of a political party before an election. Charter

H2.text: What name is given to the declaration of aims and policies of a political party before an election. Declaration

H3.text: What name is given to the declaration of aims and policies of a political party before an election. Manifesto

A4.text: A political party platform (North American English), party program, or party manifesto (preferential term in British and often Commonwealth English) is a formal set of principal goals which are supported by a political party or individual candidate, to appeal to the general public, for the ultimate purpose of garnering the general public's support and votes about complicated topics or issues.

A5.text: The manifesto contains election pledges, or election promises.

A6.text: Electronic Manifestos Canada â€“ Manifestos of Canada's major political parties since 1949.

A7.text: Suid-Afrikaanse algemene verkiesingsmanifeste, 1910-1981 = South African general election manifestos, 1910-1981 by Kleynhans, W. A. Manifestos of various political parties in South Africa from 1910 to 1981.
